title: [Self-directed] Blended Mathematics Competency Enhancement Program for College Entrance Exam Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of high school-level foundational mathematical concepts
context.additional_context: Weekend Intensive Program for Working Professionals, Featuring a Blended Learning Environment Using Digital Devices

learning_goals: Participants improve mathematical reasoning skills required for college entrance exams by over 30%.

By the end of the 2â€“4 week course, participants describe the problem-solving process for eight or more of the ten given math problems step-by-step (problem understanding, strategy development, calculation, verification) and submit a report meeting 90% or more of the required elements (assumptions, formula application, unit notation, etc.) for each step.

Participants compare pre- and post-assessment data over two weeks to identify three or more individual learning gap areas (functions, calculus, statistics, etc.), and create a one-page personalized learning plan based on the analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
